alert.note: Alert for Broome; Chenango; Cortland; Delaware; Otsego; Southern Cayuga; Tompkins (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 9:06PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW BANDS IN CENTRAL NEW YORK... At 9 PM EST, a lake effect snow band stretched from southern Onondaga and Madison Counties, where Winter Weather Advisories were in effect, into northern Chenango and central Otsego Counties. Another band stretched across southern Cortland County into southern Chenango County. Both bands were nearly stationary, but will slowly drift south through midnight. Snowfall rates may approach 1 inch per hour over highly localized areas, which could result in 2 to 3 inches of snowfall. Visibility will also be reduced to under a quarter of a mile at times. Major roadways impacted include Interstate 81 between Marathon and Cortland, and between Tully and Nedrow. Portions of Interstate 88 near Bainbridge and Sidney, and between Schenevus and Oneonta, will also be impacted.

area.areaDesc: Broome; Chenango; Cortland; Delaware; Otsego; Southern Cayuga; Tompkins
